OFFICE O
The Seal of
PIDUGURALLA:: 2 ::
I hereby settle to you the immovable property valued at Rs.9,16,000/- (Nine Lakh Sixteen Thousand Rupees in words) which has been in my possession and possession since that date and which I have full authority to possess and enjoy. This settlement property is hereby transferred to you on this day. I hereby relinquish all my rights over this settlement property from today onwards. From today, you, your heirs, and your successors shall enjoy this settlement property freely with all rights of donation, exchange, sale, and all rights of inheritance, to your children, grandchildren, descendants, and descendants. Neither you, your heirs, nor I, nor my heirs, who are enjoying this property, can make any disputes, obstacles, or claims. I declare that this settlement property is undisputed, free from any encumbrances, encumbrances, bank loans, court seizures, or any other kind of binding, and that no sales contracts, etc. have been written to anyone, and I have made a settlement with you. I will settle all the previous disputes, encumbrances and claims regarding this settlement property at my own expense and keep this settlement property for you. From today onwards, you will have to pay the house tax and electricity bills related to this property in your name.
This is my consent.
GJhansi

The Sea of
PIDUGURALLA1. This property is not assigned. The endowment does not belong to them.
2. This property is not owned by the Government, its subsidiaries, or the above companies. Not a mortgaged property.
3. The property transferred by this deed does not include any buildings, mango, coconut trees or plantations, precious minerals, granite or other stone quarries, machinery, fish ponds, etc. We agree to take action against us under sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act and pay depreciation duty if any fact is found to be concealed in this deed.
4. I/We hereby certify under section 22(b) of the Indian Stamp Act that no other encroachment has been made on this property by me/us or by any agent on my/our behalf.
The survey number, door number, I certify that all the measurements and details given are correct. In case of any discrepancy, the Government of India shall be liable to pay a penalty of three times the actual stamp duty as per section 41(a) of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899, in case of any deficiency in payment of stamp duty as amended by section 70(2) of the Indian Stamp (Andhra Pradesh Amendment) Act No. 16/2002. I hereby certify that I have duly recorded in the said document the full facts relating to the levy of stamp duty under section 27 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899, the consideration and the market value of the property and the stamp duty payable under the said section 27. We hereby declare that in case we fail to act as aforesaid, we shall be liable to be prosecuted under Section 70 for the recovery of the said amount by imposing penalty and stamp duty as per Section 64 and 64A. We hereby declare that we have entered in the deed all the particulars necessary for the identification of the property, including the boundaries, door number, full address, etc., including the plan, in accordance with Section 21 of the Indian Registration Act, 1908. All the above matters have been read out and heard in full in the presence of the following witnesses. We hereby acknowledge that all these are our words and deeds and that the scribe has written down all that we have said. GJhansi Sheet Endorsement Book No: 1 CS No/Year: 11449/2025

As you have seen the said document, the clerk of the document has mistakenly stated that the eastern boundary of the said document is Bazaar and the northern boundary is Jakkula Apparao. Instead of writing, Jakkula Apparao on the eastern boundary and Bazaar on the northern boundary have been mistakenly written. You have noticed the mistake and requested me to correct the said mistake and issue an amendment deed, so I have also agreed to write and issue this amendment deed to all of them. Apart from that, there is no change in the value of the property or in the names of those who have registered and registered. The mistake has been corrected in the schedule. You will not acquire any new rights by virtue of this amendment deed, and the rights and powers existing in the existing deed will not be affected in any way. This amendment deed should be read in conjunction with the settlement deed bearing deed No. 11501/2025. This is our consent.

Declaration
This declaration is to inform that in the course of preparing this document,
we have thoroughly
examined all the necessary elements including property details, land related passbooks, copies of the documents, 1B copies, link
documents, tax receipts for the land/houses, details of the parties in the link document, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, property details and have got this document prepared.
No elements that should have been written or included have been omitted in this document. The property was physically inspected and measured and the deed was written. As per the schedule, I have not made any encroachments, encumbrances, bank loans, etc. to anyone and I have filed a deed stating that the property is in my possession. In the future, the officials (Registration and Stamp Duty) will find the property in the said deed during the inspection of the property in the said deed, and we are fully responsible for the deficiency in the stamp of the property or all the above matters. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 11501 of 2025, dated 11/Dec/2025, executed by Gogula Jhansi Lakshmi in favour of her Daughter In Law, Gogula Lakshmi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 74 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 19-1041/110, Assessment No. 1132011487, comprised in survey number 895/25A1, 895/25A2, situated in Piduguralla Village, Piduguralla Mandal, within the District of Palnadu, registered at sub-registrar office Piduguralla, is bounded as follows: Boundaries As Per Deed North by: Bazar South by: House Of Chimata Pushpalatha East by: Site Of Jakkula Apparao West by: Site Of Jala Arogyaraju Boundaries As Per Rectification Deed North by: Property Of Jakkula Apparao South by: Property Of Chimata Pushpalatha East by: Bazar West by: Property Of Jala Arogyaraju
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
